title: Should the Meditation mastery effect energy as well?
body: the meditation is an extremely useful pick for mana based champion, but i feel, as a {{champion:98}}  player, champions with energy miss out. it would provide a small amount of energy regen so energy champions wont be left high and dry in the middle of a team fight. please let me know what you think in the comments.

replies.body: wow you literally said "extremely" "useful" "pick" for mana based "champion". how is that in any dimension better than 5% more damage to lower health champs? it honestly baffles me how i am witnessing such a statement in this lifetime that i live in. also the only reason you should be in the cunning tree for shen is if you're support, but if you are, gj, i like shen supp, its not that good especially in solo queue but you can catch a lot of adcs off guard

It beats 5% more damage to lower health champs when:

1. You play a champ that kills regardless of the 5% damage. (Veigar, who even has the passive to make it a lot better, I'm considering skipping chalice completely and going for boots and 5 full AP items because of how effective it is)
2. You play a champ that doesn't even deal that much damage (Soraka, who has serious mana issues early on and doesn't even scale that well in terms of damage)
3. When mana beats damage on extremely mana hungry champs early on (Maybe Swain or Anivia, and possibly Veigar for farming in lane)

So I'd pick 5% damage when I'm playing a poke champ, non caster ADC or non mana champ.

BUT, on champions like Lucian and Ashe who are marksmen don't have mana problems later on but have really powerful abilities, I like to go 3 on one and 2 on the other.

okey dokey, but the next time you let someone escape with a slither of health, you be thankful you have that miniscule missing mana regen over more points in merciless. especially in the late game, when kills and not dying is the most important thing in the game, and mana is absolutely not an issue on anyone even if they normally do or dont build around more mana/regen as their items. ESPECIALLY LUCIAN, who now builds essence reaver, of all items.

soraka.....really m8.....but veigar would still want merciless, you dont ALWAYS blow people up, you might still be behind but you can almost always get them low, if not lower with this mastery, if you use full combo. but he has an in-build mana font.....so thats some pretty bad examples. so pretty much soraka, some other low damage supports like alistar and.......i cant think of any.......even blitz, if he pulls an adc at 50%, they're now down to 40%, an E and an ult might now do a further 2% of their health if the E-ult does 30% of their health and then it might only take 1-2 autos from adc to finish them off instead of 3 which the adc might not get if they flash under tower

Alright, and next time I go OOM as an AP champ when the enemy is one ability away from dying, I'll be glad my auto attack can deal 5% more damage.

With Veigar, I always blow people up, or I never get close. I can't think of a time when 5% damage would've put anything I've busted but failed to kill over the line, and if that did happen, it wouldn't if my Athene's slot had something with 100 AP. Also, he doesn't really gain a mana font, but he gains a mana font font, which increases his mana font per missing mana. Even more so if I had to recall because I didn't have enough mana in lane, giving me less AP for later game.

I've only played Lucian once but I didn't get any mana issues even without essence reaver (I can't remember if I had meditation but I'm pretty sure I didn't) so I'm starting to feel like it's an oddly shaped piece that fits neither Ezreal nor Lucian.

i watch phreaks vids, this one wasnt helpful at all, ok maybe a little bit. but you cant blame him, that was ages ago, he wouldnt have known half of what i know about the keystones now. 

yes the cunning tree does all sorts of stuff but specifically i just want you and everyone to please understand that even if shen did get energy regen from that mastery, in that similar amplitude of impact compared to mana champs, he should still get executioner anyway as its so much better on pretty much every champ let alone one with a fairly short cd taunt that allows you to then combo your Q and passive, but then nothing else.....because that is all shen is.....hopefully you've caught someone off guard after ulting though, which is what usually happens amirite lel

While I see where you are coming from, especially from the Shen perspective, I disagree that Executioner is always better, i would say Executioner is better depending on the champ it is used with (E.g. Katarina, Zed)

there is nothing more satisfying, then seeing  "F--K that Shield" or "F--k that taunt" in /All chat while playing Shen lol
Energy already regens at a much higher rate than Mana, therefore making energy champions less reliant on resources. So no, I don't believe it should include Energy in the Meditation mastery.
